repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: Letters from Frances Perkins to Frances White. The collection also includes a sheet of U.S. postage stamps commemorating Ms. Perkins, and newspaper clippings concerning her life, career, and death.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: United States Secretary of Labor, 1933-1945; lecturer at the New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations at Cornell University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frances Perkins Correspondence and Memorabilia #5017. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: /3047 AV: Frances Perkins Lectures 5065m: Frances Perkins Letter to Donald Stetson 5812: Interviews about Frances Perkins

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a sheet of "Frances Perkins" 15 cent postage stamps, a program for the "Dedication of the Frances Perkins Building" in Washington, DC, and a certificate stating that a US flag flown over the United States Capitol was given to Mr. Don Stetson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes newspaper clippings of obituaries and memorial service programs.
